title: Geth Start-Up Error
body:
#### System information

Geth version: Version: 1.7.0-stable
                       Git Commit: 6c6c7b2af3efdad4d2f64f70f3a724af434bbcd2
OS & Version: Linux (Ubuntu 16.04.3 LTS)
Commit hash : (if `develop`)

#### Expected behaviour
 Expected behavior is, the GETH should start syncing

#### Actual behaviour

It starts setting up the client for syncing but then fails. and gives me a [signal SIGSEV] error. Below are the logs

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
I ran the below command:

geth --testnet --cache=1024 --identity "FirstTestNode_gCloud" --rpc --rpcpo
rt "8545" --rpccorsdomain "*" --rpcapi "db,eth,net,web3,debug" --rpcaddr "<IP_Address>" --verbosity=3 --syncmode=fast

#### Backtrace

After sometime, the above issue got resolved automatically, but then I started getting the below issue:
``````
Error starting protocol stack: listen tcp 35.185.208.38:8545: bind: cannot assign requested address
``````

I am trying to setup my client on Google Compute Engine as I have had bad experiences on AWS as the client used shutdown automatically.

Probably something already listening, or not your actual address? Try `netstat -nlp`, and `ifconfig`. I'd guess you're on a private network, whereas `35.185.208.38` is a load balancer or firewall or something.
